article_title: Want to Pay Higher Prices? Try a For-Profit Hospital!

article_metadata.author: Peter Ubel

og.description: Out of the 50 U.S. hospitals with the largest price markups, 49 are for-profit institutions, marking up charges 9 to 12 times above what Medicare would pay. That is the conclusion drawn in a recent study published in Health Affairs. The U.S. hospital industry has a price problem. And as it turns out, that problem is especially problematic at some of our largest for-profit hospital chains.
